result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:40 AM Defendant Hector E Pena Soto in court with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Court addresses the defendant's WCS non-compliance and inclined to just admonish the defendant.  Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration is left up by order of the Trial Court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

03:21 PM Defendant Hector E Pena Soto in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney. The Defendant is seeking to retain attorney Dorlack.
